main event: A single orange-colored object was observed in Monrovia, Indiana on 12 July 1956. It ascended at high speed, descended, and then ascended again, observed for approximately 30 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a quarter held at arm's length.
It was seen heading northwest at a high speed before ascending straight up for thirty seconds.
The report indicated that it could be a possible aircraft or balloon.
The observation duration was relatively short, approximately 30 seconds.
The report included photographs of the object.
